intro: Teijsmanniodendron latiffii, commonly known as the Malayan ironwood, is a rare and woody plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
